revised_title: Investigating Instrumental Errors in Magnetic Dip Observations
tldr: The author investigates the instrumental errors in magnetic dip observations, focusing on the effects of elliptical axle shape and displacement of the center of gravity in the dipping-needle. They develop a method to determine the true dip by analyzing the mean of the apparent dips in different positions and reversing the magnetism of the needle. The author plans to test this method further to determine if the true dip can be accurately measured with a single needle.
